course_description: ANT 499 is an integrative experience intended to deepen students' understanding of the field of Anthropology. It will include reflections on the field, practice, and ethics of anthropology as well as on diverse approaches to doing, writing, and representing anthropological research.
prerequisites: ANT 202 or ANTH_OX 202 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3641, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: M. Peletz, Status: Open
